info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON AND BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 321 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Wando, or 10 miles north of Mount Pleasant, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Mount Pleasant, McClellanville, Awendaw, Garris Landing, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Cape Island, Price Inlet and Bull Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
